title: Lots of Strategist-Approved SkinMedica Products Are on Sale at Dermstore
text:
8 items in this article 8 items on sale! Photo: Courtesy of the vendor

Though SkinMedica might not be the flashiest or most popular skin-care company, it’s a brand that’s come up over and over again in our reporting, recommended by dermatologists and skin-care obsessives alike for being effective and reliable. It’s also usually pretty expensive, but right now, rarely-on-sale SkinMedica products are 15 percent off at Dermstore. So whether you’re dealing with rosacea, the side effects of Accutane, discoloration, or just want an effective, hydrating night cream, now’s the time to stock up on these Strategist-approved and expert-recommended picks.

SkinMedica Redness Relief Calmplex $75 (was $88, now 15% off) For those with rosacea and redness-prone skin, dermatologist Debra Jaliman recommends this niacinamide-rich moisturizer, which targets inflammation and reduces redness. $75 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica Essential Defense Everyday Clear Broad Spectrum SPF 47 $32 (was $38, now 16% off) Barret Wertz is a freelance beauty and grooming writer — and a man with glowing skin. The final step of his skin-care routine is this chemical-and-mineral combination sunscreen, which “blends really easily and has zinc oxide, which is just one of the best sun protectants.” $32 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica HA5 Rejuvenating Hydrator $151 (was $178, now 15% off) If you’re looking for an investment moisturizer to hydrate extra-dry winter skin, dermatologist Noelani Gonzalez says to look no further than this SkinMedica hydrator. It blends five different types of hydrators for plump, soft skin, and “is noncomedogenic, which means it won’t cause pimples.” $151 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica Age Defense Retinol Complex $79 (was $93, now 15% off) Gonzalez also recommends this retinol-based night cream, which gives your skin “a more rejuvenated look” overnight, thanks to its mix of vitamins, essential oils, and antioxidants. $79 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica Lytera 2.0 Pigment Correcting Serum $131 (was $154, now 15% off) Multiple dermatologists named this serum among the best moisturizers for treating melasma, because it combines skin-brightening ingredients that target discoloration. $131 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica TNS Ceramide Treatment Cream $59 (was $69, now 14% off) Many Accutane users find that a side effect of the oil-reducing medication is dry skin, so dermatologist Yunyoung Claire Chang suggests using this restorative, peptide-rich cream to keep skin hydrated and prevent signs of aging. $59 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica TNS Essential Serum $239 (was $281, now 15% off) At Peggy Siegal’s 70th birthday party the powerful publicist handed out pink pamphlets titled, “How to Look Like Me at 70,” which detailed her beauty routine for looking sprightly. One of the products that she swears by is this SkinMedica serum: “You pump two squirts on your hands, and rub it together. Morning and night. I’m religious about it.” $239 at Dermstore Buy

SkinMedica HA5 Smooth and Plump Lip System $58 (was $68, now 15% off) Hyaluronic acid is a celebrated substance in the Strategist beauty world, and just as it hydrates skin, dermatologist Joshua Zeichner explains that it can “enhance hydration and plumpness of lips.” For a subtle lip-plumping boost, he recommends this plumping and rejuvenating SkinMedica lip system. $58 at Dermstore Buy
